credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: The Elevation of a Silver or Silver Gilt Tureen
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli. Purchased from the general funds from Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gouache,  watercolor on  off-white laid paper
description: The left half suggests a much richer decoration--with rocaille and floral motifs--than the right one. The handle at left is composed of scrolls and a sea harp, the right one of scrolls and a shell. Two putti hold an escutcheon on top of the cover.
name: Drawing
